text: 1936 Jaffa riots Part of the 1936–1939 Arab revolt in Palestine Police dispersing a crowd Location Jaffa, Mandatory Palestine Coordinates 32°03′08″N 34°45′11″E﻿ / ﻿32.05222°N 34.75306°E﻿ / 32.05222; 34.75306 Date 19–21 April 1936 Attack type Riot Deaths 9 Jews 2 Arabs Perpetrators Palestinian Arabs The Jaffa riots of April 1936, refers to a spate of violent attacks on Jews that began on 19 April 1936 in Jaffa. A total of 14 Jews and 2 Arabs were killed during the riots. A lot of people say it was the start of the 1936–1939 Arab revolt in Palestine. == See also == * Zionist militias * 1938 Tiberias massacre * 1921 Jaffa riots == Footnotes == Category:Mandatory Palestine Category:Arab–Israeli conflict Category:20th- century riots
title: Jaffa riots (April 1936)
